page.title: 01PANORAMA-HAMSTERLEY AREA
page.content: The village of Hamsterley lies in a rural area of hills and valleys rising in the western section to a heather clad grouse moor,a thousand feet high. South and east of this the Forestry Commission has over 5000 acres of coniferous plantations,covering the steep sided valleys.Leisure activities are catered for alongside the timber industry and conservation of natural flora and fauna is vigorously pursued. In contrast the eastern section is open farmland,well watered by streams and springs,making the valley floors and lower slopes fertile.The main emphasis is on sheep farming,with some beef rearing,utilising the grass. The village,with its duckpond and greens, houses the majority of the population.Others live in farms,lodges or cottages or large country houses.
